6075dca90c8a7c94:
%BEGIN-ASP
person: roberta; thelma; steve; pete.
job: chef; guard; nurse; telephone_operator; police_officer; teacher; actor; boxer.
gender: male; female.
%END-ASP
5351350b2ce63b0a:
%BEGIN-ASP
person(roberta).  
person(thelma).  
person(steve).  
person(pete).  

job(chef).  
job(guard).  
job(nurse).  
job(telephone_operator).  
job(police_officer).  
job(teacher).  
job(actor).  
job(boxer).  

gender(male).  
gender(female).  

% precies twee jobs per persoon  
2 { holds(P,J) : job(J) } 2 :- person(P).

% geen job gedeeld door twee personen  
1 { holds(P,J) : person(P) } 1 :- job(J).

% precies één gender per persoon  
1 { has_gender(P,G) : gender(G) } 1 :- person(P).
%END-ASP
043a7a2a35397676:
%BEGIN-ASP
% Nurse is male; Actor is male.
:- holds(P,nurse), not has_gender(P,male).
:- holds(P,actor), not has_gender(P,male).

% Chef is female; telephone_operator is male; die twee zijn verschillende personen.
:- holds(P,chef), not has_gender(P,female).
:- holds(P,telephone_operator), not has_gender(P,male).
:- holds(P1,chef), holds(P2,telephone_operator), P1 = P2.

% Roberta is not a boxer.
:- holds(roberta,boxer).

% Pete kan niet teacher, nurse of police_officer zijn.
:- holds(pete,teacher).
:- holds(pete,nurse).
:- holds(pete,police_officer).

% Roberta, de chef en de police_officer zijn drie verschillende personen.
:- holds(roberta,chef).
:- holds(roberta,police_officer).
:- holds(P1,chef), holds(P2,police_officer), P1 = P2.

% Genderfeiten
has_gender(roberta,female).
has_gender(thelma,female).
has_gender(steve,male).
has_gender(pete,male).
%END-ASP
